channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Mathador-LM: A Dynamic Benchmark for Mathematical Reasoning on Large Language Models
item.description: We introduce Mathador-LM, a new benchmark for evaluating the mathematical reasoning on large language models (LLMs), combining ruleset interpretation, planning, and problem-solving.

item.title: Knowledge Fusion By Evolving Weights of Language Models
item.description: Fine-tuning pre-trained language models, particularly large language models, demands extensive computing resources and can result in varying performance outcomes across different domains and datasets.

item.title: A data-centric approach for assessing progress of Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Therefore, we define homophily and Cross-Class Neighborhood Similarity for multi-label classification and investigate $9$ collected multi-label datasets.

item.title: TSI-Bench: Benchmarking Time Series Imputation
item.description: Despite the development of numerous deep learning algorithms for time series imputation, the community lacks standardized and comprehensive benchmark platforms to effectively evaluate imputation performance across different settings.

item.title: Evaluating Transparency of Machine Generated Fact Checking Explanations
item.description: In this work, we investigate the impact of human-curated vs. machine-selected evidence for explanation generation using large language models.

item.title: More Efficient Randomized Exploration for Reinforcement Learning via Approximate Sampling
item.description: Empirically, we show that in tasks where deep exploration is necessary, our proposed algorithms that combine FGTS and approximate sampling perform significantly better compared to other strong baselines.

item.title: PCIE_LAM Solution for Ego4D Looking At Me Challenge
item.description: This report presents our team's 'PCIE_LAM' solution for the Ego4D Looking At Me Challenge at CVPR2024.

item.title: Interpretable Preferences via Multi-Objective Reward Modeling and Mixture-of-Experts
item.description: The trained RM serves as a proxy for human preferences.

item.title: Fast and Slow Generating: An Empirical Study on Large and Small Language Models Collaborative Decoding
item.description: Collaborative decoding between large and small language models (SLMs) offers a novel approach to address these challenges.

item.title: IPEval: A Bilingual Intellectual Property Agency Consultation Evaluation Benchmark for Large Language Models
item.description: The rapid development of Large Language Models (LLMs) in vertical domains, including intellectual property (IP), lacks a specific evaluation benchmark for assessing their understanding, application, and reasoning abilities.

item.title: AITTI: Learning Adaptive Inclusive Token for Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: Specifically, the core of our method is a lightweight adaptive mapping network, which can customize the inclusive tokens for the concepts to be de-biased, making the tokens generalizable to unseen concepts regardless of their original bias distributions.

item.title: OlympicArena: Benchmarking Multi-discipline Cognitive Reasoning for Superintelligent AI
item.description: We delve into the models' cognitive reasoning abilities, their performance across different modalities, and their outcomes in process-level evaluations, which are vital for tasks requiring complex reasoning with lengthy solutions.

item.title: PCIE_EgoHandPose Solution for EgoExo4D Hand Pose Challenge
item.description: Our approach achieved the 1st position in the Hand Pose challenge with 25. 51 MPJPE and 8. 49 PA-MPJPE.

item.title: CollabStory: Multi-LLM Collaborative Story Generation and Authorship Analysis
item.description: Despite this, there have not been efforts to explore such collaborative writing.

item.title: TSI-Bench: Benchmarking Time Series Imputation
item.description: Despite the development of numerous deep learning algorithms for time series imputation, the community lacks standardized and comprehensive benchmark platforms to effectively evaluate imputation performance across different settings.

item.title: Stealth edits for provably fixing or attacking large language models
item.description: We reveal new methods and the theoretical foundations of techniques for editing large language models.

item.title: Hierarchical Prompting Taxonomy: A Universal Evaluation Framework for Large Language Models
item.description: We introduce the Hierarchical Prompting Taxonomy (HPT), a taxonomy that employs a Hierarchical Prompt Framework (HPF) composed of five unique prompting strategies, arranged from the simplest to the most complex, to assess LLMs more precisely and to offer a clearer perspective.

item.title: PlanRAG: A Plan-then-Retrieval Augmented Generation for Generative Large Language Models as Decision Makers
item.description: In this paper, we conduct a study to utilize LLMs as a solution for decision making that requires complex data analysis.

item.title: Unmasking the Veil: An Investigation into Concept Ablation for Privacy and Copyright Protection in Images
item.description: In this paper, we extend the study of concept ablation within pre-trained models as introduced in 'Ablating Concepts in Text-to-Image Diffusion Models' by (Kumari et al., 2022).

item.title: Adversarial Attacks on Multimodal Agents
item.description: Our attacks use adversarial text strings to guide gradient-based perturbation over one trigger image in the environment: (1) our captioner attack attacks white-box captioners if they are used to process images into captions as additional inputs to the VLM; (2) our CLIP attack attacks a set of CLIP models jointly, which can transfer to proprietary VLMs.

item.title: Privacy Preserving Federated Learning in Medical Imaging with Uncertainty Estimation
item.description: However, FL, while robust in privacy preservation, faces several challenges.

item.title: GeoBench: Benchmarking and Analyzing Monocular Geometry Estimation Models
item.description: While discriminative monocular geometry estimation methods rely on large-scale fine-tuning data to achieve zero-shot generalization, several generative-based paradigms show the potential of achieving impressive generalization performance on unseen scenes by leveraging pre-trained diffusion models and fine-tuning on even a small scale of synthetic training data.

item.title: Benchmarking Multi-Image Understanding in Vision and Language Models: Perception, Knowledge, Reasoning, and Multi-Hop Reasoning
item.description: The advancement of large language models (LLMs) has significantly broadened the scope of applications in natural language processing, with multi-modal LLMs extending these capabilities to integrate and interpret visual data.

item.title: Faithful Density-Peaks Clustering via Matrix Computations on MPI Parallelization System
item.description: Density peaks clustering (DP) has the ability of detecting clusters of arbitrary shape and clustering non-Euclidean space data, but its quadratic complexity in both computing and storage makes it difficult to scale for big data.

item.title: WebCanvas: Benchmarking Web Agents in Online Environments
item.description: To bridge this gap, we introduce WebCanvas, an innovative online evaluation framework for web agents that effectively addresses the dynamic nature of web interactions.

item.title: RS-GPT4V: A Unified Multimodal Instruction-Following Dataset for Remote Sensing Image Understanding
item.description: Under the new LaGD paradigm, the old datasets, which have led to advances in RSI intelligence understanding in the last decade, are no longer suitable for fire-new tasks.

item.title: Talk With Human-like Agents: Empathetic Dialogue Through Perceptible Acoustic Reception and Reaction
item.description: This oversight can lead to misinterpretations of speakers' intentions, resulting in inconsistent or even contradictory responses within dialogues.

item.title: A Neural Column Generation Approach to the Vehicle Routing Problem with Two-Dimensional Loading and Last-In-First-Out Constraints
item.description: The vehicle routing problem with two-dimensional loading constraints (2L-CVRP) and the last-in-first-out (LIFO) rule presents significant practical and algorithmic challenges.

item.title: Symmetric Multi-Similarity Loss for EPIC-KITCHENS-100 Multi-Instance Retrieval Challenge 2024
item.description: In this report, we present our champion solution for EPIC-KITCHENS-100 Multi-Instance Retrieval Challenge in CVPR 2024.

item.title: Automatically Generating Narrative-Style Radiology Reports from Volumetric CT Images; a Proof of Concept
item.description: This study introduces a deep learning-based proof of concept model to accurately identify abnormalities in volumetric CT data and generate narrative-style reports.

item.title: VRSBench: A Versatile Vision-Language Benchmark Dataset for Remote Sensing Image Understanding
item.description: We introduce a new benchmark designed to advance the development of general-purpose, large-scale vision-language models for remote sensing images.

item.title: Problem-Solving in Language Model Networks
item.description: While these methods enhance performance, the application of collective intelligence-based approaches to complex network structures and the dynamics of agent interactions remain underexplored.

item.title: News Without Borders: Domain Adaptation of Multilingual Sentence Embeddings for Cross-lingual News Recommendation
item.description: Rapidly growing numbers of multilingual news consumers pose an increasing challenge to news recommender systems in terms of providing customized recommendations.

item.title: Holmes-VAD: Towards Unbiased and Explainable Video Anomaly Detection via Multi-modal LLM
item.description: We train a lightweight temporal sampler to select frames with high anomaly response and fine-tune a multimodal large language model (LLM) to generate explanatory content.

item.title: Demystifying the Recency Heuristic in Temporal-Difference Learning
item.description: The recency heuristic in reinforcement learning is the assumption that stimuli that occurred closer in time to an acquired reward should be more heavily reinforced.

item.title: Automatic benchmarking of large multimodal models via iterative experiment programming
item.description: Finally, the LLM refines the report, presenting the results to the user in natural language.

item.title: Ask-before-Plan: Proactive Language Agents for Real-World Planning
item.description: In this work, we introduce a new task, Proactive Agent Planning, which requires language agents to predict clarification needs based on user-agent conversation and agent-environment interaction, invoke external tools to collect valid information, and generate a plan to fulfill the user's demands.

item.title: ViDSOD-100: A New Dataset and a Baseline Model for RGB-D Video Salient Object Detection
item.description: However, the existing salient object detection (SOD) works only focus on either static RGB-D images or RGB videos, ignoring the collaborating of RGB-D and video information.

item.title: TroL: Traversal of Layers for Large Language and Vision Models
item.description: Large language and vision models (LLVMs) have been driven by the generalization power of large language models (LLMs) and the advent of visual instruction tuning.

item.title: LayerMerge: Neural Network Depth Compression through Layer Pruning and Merging
item.description: Existing depth compression methods remove redundant non-linear activation functions and merge the consecutive convolution layers into a single layer.

item.title: Breaking the Ceiling of the LLM Community by Treating Token Generation as a Classification for Ensembling
item.description: In this paper, we treat the Generation of each token by LLMs as a Classification (GaC) for ensembling.

item.title: Open-Source Web Service with Morphological Dictionary-Supplemented Deep Learning for Morphosyntactic Analysis of Czech
item.description: We present an open-source web service for Czech morphosyntactic analysis.

item.title: Low-Resource Machine Translation through the Lens of Personalized Federated Learning
item.description: We present a new approach based on the Personalized Federated Learning algorithm MeritFed that can be applied to Natural Language Tasks with heterogeneous data.

item.title: BIOSCAN-5M: A Multimodal Dataset for Insect Biodiversity
item.description: We propose three benchmark experiments to demonstrate the impact of the multi-modal data types on the classification and clustering accuracy.

item.title: The Heterophilic Snowflake Hypothesis: Training and Empowering GNNs for Heterophilic Graphs
item.description: Based on observations, we innovatively introduce the Heterophily Snowflake Hypothesis and provide an effective solution to guide and facilitate research on heterophilic graphs and beyond.

item.title: Insect Identification in the Wild: The AMI Dataset
item.description: Insects represent half of all global biodiversity, yet many of the world's insects are disappearing, with severe implications for ecosystems and agriculture.

item.title: Cephalometric Landmark Detection across Ages with Prototypical Network
item.description: To our knowledge, this is the first effort toward developing a unified solution and dataset for cephalometric landmark detection across age groups.

item.title: Federated Learning with a Single Shared Image
item.description: To this end, in this paper, we introduce a new method that improves this knowledge distillation method to only rely on a single shared image between clients and server.

item.title: LaMDA: Large Model Fine-Tuning via Spectrally Decomposed Low-Dimensional Adaptation
item.description: LaMDA freezes a first projection matrix (PMA) in the adaptation path while introducing a low-dimensional trainable square matrix, resulting in substantial reductions in trainable parameters and peak GPU memory usage.

item.title: HumanSplat: Generalizable Single-Image Human Gaussian Splatting with Structure Priors
item.description: Despite recent advancements in high-fidelity human reconstruction techniques, the requirements for densely captured images or time-consuming per-instance optimization significantly hinder their applications in broader scenarios.
